website_summaries.verdict: So fun to assemble, kids won't even realize they're gaining basic physics and problem-solving skills.
pros: Includes 46 gears, pillars, base plates, and crank handle
Good starter kit to see if your child would be interested
Often captures the attention of children on the autism spectrum
cons: Crank can be hard to turn at first

website_summaries.verdict: This brightly-colored gear set has more than 100 pieces for your child to explore and build simple designs. She can also design her own creation. For ages 3 and up.
pros: Choice of primary colors or pastels
Interconnecting gears give opportunity to experiment with simple mechanics
Supports STEM through sorting, grouping, designing and introducing to physics
cons: Foundation pieces are hard to snap into place, but this can encourage you to work with the child

customer_reviews.title: These are lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: I got these for our two and a half year old but they're more suited for our seven year old and adults hahaha. Seriously you'll have just as much fun messing with these as the kids. I need to get some more. These are educational and a blast!
customer_reviews.author: Tony & Brie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great for imagining kids
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 3year old son and really loves. At first he was all about building them with gears. Now he just likes to build the towers and pipeline without the gears. Great for kids who like to imagine and stay occupied. I'd highly recommend this to parents instead of ipads and TV. Still hours and hours of fun. I just wish the gears were more connected when put in different directions. LIke if you put one top and second one you put on the top of the first in different direction, it doesn't interconnect. IF it was, i'd give it all 5's. Very durable product.
customer_reviews.author: Shan Gabbar

customer_reviews.title: rotating legos!
customer_reviews.text: even an adult can entertain themselves for hours! not saying i have, just hypothetical! toys these days! they are amazing! Edit: so it's been 10 months since purchasing and my son decided to play with it. He accidentally snapped one of the plates. Upon inspection the plastic pieces have become quite brittle and took hardly any pressure to accidentally break it while playing with it. So while the toy is great, it certainly isn't going to last long as I expect it to be.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie B.

customer_reviews.title: Intro to Gears and how they work
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grand kids last Christmas. The kids enjoyed putting it together, turning the crank, and watching everything turn, or redesigning what did not turn. I like the idea that the kids are being introduced to the principles of simple machines-gears. When the kids set it aside, the parents played with it for quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: nhg419

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice toy. And the number of pieces this box comes with allows for a good number of different designs. However I wish there were more options to transfer motion into specific directions through appositely designed pieces. With the design of the existing pieces you are somewhat limited. I believe the manufacturer is trying to avoid creating situations where motion and counter motion might be transmitted to the same piece simultaneously. Still I wish they would have left the builder to pay attention to that and just provide the options.
customer_reviews.author: Loris

customer_reviews.title: fun but doesn't seem to hold her interest long
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 5 year old daughter. She seems to like it but it doesn't hold her interest long. She prefers to make free-standing toys out of the gears instead of making things on the gear pads. I will say the green gear pads are very difficult to put together (they are a tight fit) so I have to put those together for her. But the pieces are well-made and nothing has broke. Overall we like them and I think it challenges her mind to build things differently; perhaps as she gets older it will hold her attention more.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy but chocking hazard for little ones
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday gift for my 3 yr old. It has many gears with additional small pieces to connect so they all work together. It’s a bit challenging at 3 but a good activity to do together. I also have an infant and read reviews that the parts were not so small to be a chocking hazard. They are. Please be aware as this would not be good in a home that also has teething aged babies.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy some STEM toys for my daughters so they can play and learn while in quarantine. I bought this thinking more of my 3 yo but my older daughter who jus turned 7, loved it as well. We definitely need to buy more of the set because it doesn’t feel like it has that many pieces while we’re playing with it. Another great product from Learning Resources!
customer_reviews.author: Maria Treviño Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Got Her Engineer On
customer_reviews.text: This is a new take on building products. You build with the gears, but the challenge is getting them all to turn when you put the handle down in any spot on your building. My 5 year old daughter had so much fun building with these, making tall buildings or bridges. She keeps coming back to play with them. The parts are easy to pop on and off. I do wish there was a book with more building challenges, but that is a reason we have an imagination. STEM Fun for younger kids!
customer_reviews.author: Katie S

customer_reviews.title: Entertainment and Educational All In One Package.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased a couple sets as gifts. EVERYONE loves them. My only 'mistake' was buying one set "Frustration Free Packaging". This means a plain boring box. No pictures on the outside. Fine if you are not giving as a gift. IF you want a box with pictures on the outside, choose standard packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Island Sun Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for Autistic kids!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item on a whim because my son who is 5 and on the autism spectrum is very mechanically inclined. He loves building toys and toys that move. I am so glad that I did! he has played with this toy the most of all of his Christmas gifts, and has come up with some pretty creative things like a fishing pole and robot. It can be a lot more than just a plank with gears attached. I've ordered more sets to add to this, so that we can build even more.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Brisson

customer_reviews.title: Nice toy for Gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these first one with 60 pieces and another one 100 to give as a gift. My 2.5-year kid love to play with this, they are easy to assemble and disassemble, there are no sharp edges so safety-wise it is good. IMO 60 pieces are enough for the kid to play.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Patel

customer_reviews.title: Makes therapy fun!
customer_reviews.text: My son already had a set of these and he loves them! his teacher recommended them for his therapies. this was the second set that I got for him and I might even get him a third set. that is how much he loves them, so he can build more bigger things!
customer_reviews.author: JessNIN

customer_reviews.title: Endless ways to build
customer_reviews.text: This set is amazing! There are endless ways to build and put these together. You can build vertical or horizontal or a combination of the two and when you crank it they all move! This is a really great set that keeps the little kiddos occupied!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Gears are cool
customer_reviews.text: The kids like it. I remember enjoying playing with a "gear toy" as a child, the more the merrier with gears I say! Gears are kind of amazing, aren't they? I wonder who invented the first gears? Anyhoo, as these were a gift I can only say I've been TOLD the kids (ages 5 and 3) are enjoying them. I hope they're instructive and make those little gears in their heads turn a bit more!
customer_reviews.author: StillLife

customer_reviews.title: Keeps toddlers occupied and entertained
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be yet another amazing Amazon recommendation for our 3 year olds. The layout is so simple, it does not matter where and how the gears are aligned - even if every post on the base plate has a gear on it, and they are all interlocked, they will all spin when the handle is turned. The concept of turning the axle from horizontal to vertical motion looks cool to me, but is too much for toddlers to grasp. They loved being able to turn the handle and see the entire set in motion. We bought a few more as gifts since our initial exposure to this set.
customer_reviews.author: Kundan Sen

customer_reviews.title: Successful gift
customer_reviews.text: My two year old granddaughter spent hours absorbed playing with these. It was great! Just a note: she has unusually well developed fine motor skills and really enjoyed carefully manipulating the parts, but many 2 year olds may not have as much fun with that degree of focus so this might be better for a slightly older child.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: Best Assembling toy ever for my 3+ year old
customer_reviews.text: My 3.5 year old son playing with this whole time. He had several toys in the past but with this he spending hours and hours. This is the best activity toy he ever enjoyed. Highly recommended if your kid likes being patient and assembling.
customer_reviews.author: jose5star

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my Grandson's birthday. I tried to get it on Prime Day, waitlisted, but couldn't get it at the reduced price. Bought it anyway, and am soooo glad I did! My daughter-in-law called us the next morning and said that he loved it so much that he put everything back into the box and slept with it! It's looking like we may need to get one for his sister for Christmas. They are 3 and 5 years old, and both of them love it. Grandpa is 58 years old, and he loves to play with it, too! 5 stars aren't enough to show how much we love this item. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Sheryl

customer_reviews.title: Nifty “toy”
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised by my girls (9 & 10) reaction to receiving this (as a school purchase)! They got to work right away with their friend and made it work! Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Fun gears
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas present for my 4 year old. He loved it instantly. The pieces secure together nicely, not too difficult for him at all. Loved that my son was able to make a miniature version of a geriatric walker like his grandpa's, among other random structures. This toy is a good building toy, but I do wish got a larger version for more versatility. So far, this toy has been played with daily.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: Such a creative toy! I bought this for my (at the time) 4 year old grandson who loved it immediately. However, now his 2 year old sister is enjoying it and we've also had 10 year old guests who couldn't get enough of it. We loved it so much that we bought the Wacky Wiggler expander set, which has some unusual pieces, along with a remote control module to animate the construction.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Everyone wants one
customer_reviews.text: Whoever has come to our wanted to buy this! I don’t need to say anything more. I am impressed with the quality and durability. Helps in critical thinking
customer_reviews.author: Ravi

customer_reviews.title: The grandkids (and grammy) love this educational toy
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and are better than what I expected. The grandkids LOVE these gears. . . . (as do some of the "adults"). Keeps the kids occupied and mentally challenged. Colors are great and the item is high quality. Very pleased with this product and plan to expand this set around Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Music junkie

customer_reviews.title: Gear's Johnny!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son for a 3rd birthday gift. Holy moly, he adores them! He has played with these more than just about any toy he's ever owned, and he's only had them for 6 weeks. He won't use them as indicated, of course. He builds his own little contraptions with them, sometimes sticking gears on plastic chopsticks and bringing me "flowers." This is so good for kids' imaginations and motor skills! Can't recommend this enough.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewToaKill

customer_reviews.title: We love this toy!
customer_reviews.text: We had so much fun playing with this. I love that the pieces are all in my daughter's favorite color palette. We were able to easily put the pieces together and create some really fun patterns. I really like that this is a learning toy that teaches cause and effect and allows my daughter to use her imagination. The possibilities are endless with this toy. #gearsgearsgears
customer_reviews.author: Jose O.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for kids and adults!
customer_reviews.text: My three year old nephew loves them! He needs help from an adult putting them together but he is definitely getting the hang of getting everything done and really enjoys these gears. They really work! It's engaging for the adults too. Not your normal kid toy. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: MillersMadhouse

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter's love it.
customer_reviews.text: Our granddaughter's loved it. It helps children learn how parts work together. However, it was still a little difficult for our five year old granddaughter to put together at times. so adult supervision is required bc little fingers are not always strong enough to put together and turn gears. with that said, our granddaughter's love it and it is education.
customer_reviews.author: Peter S. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: I got this set for my 4-year-old for Christmas and he loves playing with them! It’s something he can do independently while his older siblings do homework, etc.
customer_reviews.author: BabyJ'sMommy

customer_reviews.title: ... the pieces together (for a 3 year old) but super fun and my sone really likes it
customer_reviews.text: a little hard to put the pieces together (for a 3 year old) but super fun and my sone really likes it.... My husband helps our son put together different configurations and both are still not tired of it ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Nilson

customer_reviews.title: Cool toy, great for problem solving/critical thinking.
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little bit of hands-on action to show kids what they can do. My kids lose interest after a while, but they have busted it out again to make a "Cranky the Crane" on their Thomas train table. It's cool because we don't have to seek out a real Cranky. They can build their own! It rotates and everything, and they have the satisfaction of knowing 1. they built it! and 2. they can destroy and rebuild anything at any time. With a little training, it's a very cool toy. Also great for problem solving.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Wiseman

customer_reviews.title: Fun, safe, educational
customer_reviews.text: We gave these to our 4 (almost 5 year old) grandson for Christmas. It was by far his favorite gift. These are easy enough for little hands to work with, yet challenges them to be creative. Good for fine motor skills and problem solving.
customer_reviews.author: Jan M.

customer_reviews.title: many hours of fun and  surprisingly many different ways of putting it together
customer_reviews.text: my 3 yo and his older brother and father are having fun assembling it :) yesterday for example, they transformed gears into weapons ( my 3 yo idea) ... go figure :) I only wish that gears and other parts were "clicking"/ fitting each other better (more snug). also board parts are sliding around and i have not figured out how to make it more stable.
customer_reviews.author: Ilona Basilyan

customer_reviews.title: and it turned out to be fun for the whole family as well
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 3 year old grandson, and we were worried it might be too complicated for him. But he loves it, and it turned out to be fun for the whole family as well. If I was to do it over again, I probably would have got the next biggest set because for only a few bucks more, you get quite a few more pieces and a carry case. The gears and other pieces are very well made and they should last a long time. This is a nice toy set!
customer_reviews.author: Ray R. Kawal

customer_reviews.title: Still love waffle blocks more, but these are cool!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful toy for any child 2-12. The pieces fit easily together to form amazing small machines. You can use them for science experiments or models for science fairs of anything using gears. And instead of just 2-D representation of gears, this toy allows the child to go up and around and across, full 3-D gear work! The colors are bright and cheerful. There are enough pieces for the gears to do some serious work. As an educator and Mom and Grandma, this toy is one that is taken out quite often.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Gal

customer_reviews.title: Great STEM toy!
customer_reviews.text: Both my 6 and 3 year old love these! They can be used to make many different designs and keep them endlessly entertained. I love the problem-solving of how to make the gears move and it's a wonderfuI toy to encourgae learning through play. I wish it had more than one lever so they could both build at the same time but if I buy another set that would solve that.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P

customer_reviews.title: Alcohol is always the answer
customer_reviews.text: These were fun. They're loud, dont live in a delusion. The sounds they make as they crash together will live on in my fever dreams. Still, the kiddo loved it so if nana can't sleep she should just drink more.
customer_reviews.author: Heather L.

customer_reviews.title: but a great gift that he enjoys and will have fun years ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandson, who is almost 3. We had a blast playing with it....it's a bit difficult for him to do by himself, but a great gift that he enjoys and will have fun years to come with it!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy from Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Fun STEM toy
customer_reviews.text: We love how many ways the gears can be set up. It’s a fun STEM toy that my two year old and his daycare classmates love.
customer_reviews.author: User24

customer_reviews.title: awesome toy!
customer_reviews.text: My four year old and I love these. After a few times of us playing with them together he was fine to do it all by himself. Even snapping the green base pieces together. This, I think, is a great toy to teach cause and effect. I had thought about buying the gears monkey set, but only being able to put it together one way made me change my mind. There are a lot of possibilities for open ended play with this set. And there's just something entrancing about spinning gears.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole D

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for preschoolers.
customer_reviews.text: Great educational toy for preschoolers. My 3-4 yr old loved seeing the gears move and learning about cause and effect. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Keirn T.

customer_reviews.title: Family fun!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure who loves this more my 3yo with a engineers mind or me!! Fun colors with exciting movements so much fun we own 3 different sets!!
customer_reviews.author: russell balcomb

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: 1 year old enjoy all the rotating stuff. Still try to learn how to assemble these. Cute.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Great, creative fun!
customer_reviews.text: Girls ages 3-6 have enjoyed creating designs and problem solving with these gears. They play for hours, sometimes individually and sometimes combining three sets for a group project...fun for all ages!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this sooner
customer_reviews.text: My son really really likes this and you can take pieces with you for a mobile experience. The only con is that it only comes with one crank handle.
customer_reviews.author: Hal-9000

customer_reviews.title: TONS of gears, tons of fun
customer_reviews.text: There are a TON of gears and connectors in this package! I am so happy to purchase it. In contrast, many other lego/magnetic toys claim to have 100 pieces but 60 out of them are useless addons.
customer_reviews.author: Jianfang Zhu

customer_reviews.title: Great toy! My son had played with this at ...
customer_reviews.text: Great toy! My son had played with this at his preschool and I have seen these highly recommended. They live up to the hype. Sturdy, well made and durable. They fit together so well and even my 4 year old has good luck with them. The only downside is that even though there are tons of gears with this set there is only one crank. Not great for 2 kids.
customer_reviews.author: Christine1e

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter spent a lot of time creating a masterpiece. She even called it her artwork. She entertained herself for quite a while and loved making the gears move! Daddy even got in on the fun and played for a while. She learned a lot while creating it, like learning where to put the gears so they would all work, and how to make the structure taller or longer.
customer_reviews.author: B. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gift for kids that like to build
customer_reviews.text: My husband was really into building things when he was little, so when we saw this set, we knew it would be the perfect gift for a little boy who's birthday our baby girl had been invited to attend. It was spot on! The little guy LOVES his new gear set! He just turned 5, and so far it seems to be perfect for that age. Great gift for any little boy or girl who likes to tinker! ETA-corrected spelling mistake
customer_reviews.author: Wakegirl_13

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My grand child has Autism and I like to use the term "Specially Gifted". He is quite the builder and this toy is fantastic to push his creativity to the limit, helps with problem solving and requires an adult on occasion to assist through the rough patch. But all-in-all together you will have a fascinating time together. Having fun together is all that matters!
customer_reviews.author: Emagic

customer_reviews.title: good toy
customer_reviews.text: I thought my 4 year old grandson would love this toy, as he is a great builder. However, it didn't receive that response. Why? His pre-school already owned this and he plays with it there. I thought that if his pre-school, which has very limited space, considered it worth owning, I was glad I bought it. I personally was fascinated with it, and probably played with it as much as he did. There is something so satisfying about meshing gears and watching the movements!
customer_reviews.author: M. Abe

customer_reviews.title: This is a great ready-to-go activity that my 3-year-old girl was able to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great ready-to-go activity that my 3-year-old girl was able to quickly use. I love the size of the implements, and the quality of the product. The only thing a little disappointing is there is only one handle. For something with so many endless options, it would be nice to have the ability to control the gears from multiple points without having to take the handle off and move it. There is also a piece mentioned in the instructions that is not included but the "what's included" description on the box does not indicate this missing piece. Maybe the instructions or box design have been updated independently of each other. Overall, cool toy for little creative thinkers!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fun toy! My kids love it so much i may have to buy another.
customer_reviews.text: Great toy. Except the kids have so much fun with it its driving me crazy keeling track of whose turn it is. May have to buy another. But that's a good problem. Works great kids love it and it keeps their attention completely off of wanting to watch TV or play video games etc. Would strongly recomend if your kids are builders like mine
customer_reviews.author: J.J.

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Both my sons love playing with this, I brought another set to add onto this
customer_reviews.author: S. Neal

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my nephew for Christmas. He loved them! Quality product. Would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: jess80

customer_reviews.title: These are great! My 3 and 5 year olds can figure ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great! My 3 and 5 year olds can figure it out to make all the gears link up and turn. It's a little more advanced for my younger one to figure out how to make it taller and still turn, but if an adult or older child can sit with him, it's something that will hold his attention for 45 or so minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Momof2Boys

customer_reviews.title: Not just for little kids but big kids like Bapa (Grandpa) too
customer_reviews.text: Not just for little kids but big kids like Bapa (Grandpa) too! It's fun learning! It's a win-win for my son and me!
customer_reviews.author: Akahdrin Fireal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 3 year old!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old is obsessed with gears and so you can imagine he loved this set so much! Easy to assemble fun structures!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Gears are the best for little engineers!
customer_reviews.text: I have a grandson who has always been fascinated with wheels and things that spin. When I saw this line of toys, it was just what I needed to add to my playroom. I have bought 3 different sets but this was the first one. It comes in a nice bucket with a handle and there is still plenty of room to add extra sets, of which I purchased. Such a different type of toy but creations are endless, and fun for both young and older. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: N. NickTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great educational toy
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for kids to learn and understand how gears work.
customer_reviews.author: bemart

customer_reviews.title: Great for teaching kids mechanics concepts, and unique play
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 4 year old son and he doesn't really like it. He used the attaching pieces to make things like he would with blocks; the gears just lay on the floor. I personally think it is a great toy to teach kids mechanical concepts. I did myself have trouble figuring out how to place attaching pieces in multiple formats, so it is a good idea to guide your child with this toy so that they can see how creative they can get with this. Maybe my son will get into it later, I think it's worth hanging on to.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: A fun educational toy!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old and 4 1/2 year old grand daughters love creating different gear patterns and contraptions with this toy. I can see that as they get older, their creations will be able to become more and more complex. As they play, I can see their mental gears turning! The base is a little difficult for them to take apart but their engineer father doesn't mind playing with them and helping them put the gears away.
customer_reviews.author: BookTeacher

customer_reviews.title: Such a great gift that grows with your child.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these! We got them when he was 2 and now he's 3 1/2 yrs old and it has grown with him. When other kids come over they all want to play with this! Great to teach building with their imagination. Such a versatile toy!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Trunzo

customer_reviews.title: Looked great but had to return as it was the wrog order
customer_reviews.text: Looked like a really cool set, but I order by accident. Seem to be as described but it does have a lot of pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Kids loved them.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 3 and 4 year old and they love them. We will be buying another set soon.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: My 3 year old son and husband use this together, they like it a lot.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. My husband an son like to use this together. I honestly like anything that will get my son working and thinking. He gets frustrated sometime but when we work with him he seems to get it and like using it.
customer_reviews.author: TaraC

customer_reviews.title: and all the kids love them. I especially like that the gears can ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought several of theses sets for my grandchildren.The kids range from 2 1/2 to 5 years old, and all the kids love them. I especially like that the gears can be used flat for the younger kids, and the older kids can build up taller 3D structures.
customer_reviews.author: Jingles

customer_reviews.title: Great for a variety of ages
customer_reviews.text: My 23-month-old, almost 5-year-old, and 7-year-old all play this together. They love it. The older ones can obviously do more with it, but even my toddler loves to put the gears on the flat base. They create some very fun structures together.
customer_reviews.author: C. Netland

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: Love love love theses gear toys.... child might need help the first time. My grandson loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Tinkerbell

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy
customer_reviews.text: I would love to see more than one handle included, but great product, durable, inventive, inspiring, and wonderful hands on toy that my toddler digs.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Son Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this for my preschool-aged son for Christmas and he loves it! He thinks it's great to see how you can connect different things and it turns all the gears at once. But as a parent, you definitely have to be prepared for this being a toy with a lot of parts that are somewhat hard to keep together. But that is just the nature of the toy :-)
customer_reviews.author: K. Motes

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: My almost 5 yr old loves this toy! We love the quality of the pieces. This was a replacement from a previous gears purchase with extremely poor quality. My son loves to create and recreate. Currently he created a scene using all gears and pieces. Every single one of them works in unison with the slightest "crank". Fabulous Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: tenner14

customer_reviews.title: Good sized beginner set
customer_reviews.text: Good sized beginner set. Gears can be expensive, but are a worthwhile investment for every young child. A nice change from the usual video game addiction that is taking over young children. My nephew was excited to receive these as his Christmas gift. I enjoy using them in my early childhood classrooms to build and also for painting!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a Chinese toy ;)
customer_reviews.text: I am glad to see this product is not made in China. It is made in Korea My kid loves this toy
customer_reviews.author: Gopi Chand Komma

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: My 3yr old loves this! He won’t stop playing with it, when we get it out. It’s amazing to see how creative he can get at such a young age!
customer_reviews.author: Geefive

customer_reviews.title: 3 and 4 year kids enjoy
customer_reviews.text: Our four year old grandson is enjoying challenge of building with something other than Legos. Our grandson who just turned 3 can make really simple items and doesn't require a parent to "play" with him. Just wish set came with 2 handles to turn your Gear creation. No doubt a marketing ploy so parents with two or more children will buy multiple sets in an effort to avoid quarrels.
customer_reviews.author: 53Pennies

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the inquisitive and constructive.
customer_reviews.text: Kit comes with four bases to lay out in different shapes. Recently we've experimented with setting up vertical gears and creating bridges. My son might play with these gears more than any other toy in the toy box. He LOVES LOVES LOVES these gears!!! Only downside is that this comes with only one gear crank to turn all the gears.
customer_reviews.author: Renea

customer_reviews.title: Educational
customer_reviews.text: Educational. It would been better if it has a plastic box included for safekeeping.
customer_reviews.author: Llonzon

customer_reviews.title: Not quality. Probably won’t last long.
customer_reviews.text: Deceiving in pictures. Product isn’t as quality as I expected. A bit disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big set and cute colors
customer_reviews.text: This gears set was perfect for my daughter. She is very girly and loves all things pink, so it's nice to find a great STEM toy that appeals to little girls who still want pink things. There are a lot of gears in this set, which means even more options for her to be creative.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa N

customer_reviews.title: Gears are fun.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to our gears collection. Gears are so versatile and provide the opportunity to create endless new ideas.
customer_reviews.author: Annabelle Sue

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: Our whole family loves this! we play together with the kids, so many different ways to build them. Great quality and a very good number of pieces.
customer_reviews.author: AE-1987

customer_reviews.title: I have noticed that with the blue pieces (with the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have noticed that with the blue pieces (with the pins to attach the gears to), one pin creates more friction with the gears than the opposite side's pin. I wish they were exactly the same with lower friction so the gears would move more smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Looks fun!
customer_reviews.text: This looked fun, only returned them because I had purchased this for my boyfriends daughter and then we broke up.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K.

customer_reviews.title: It is very educational and suitable for parents to give their children.
customer_reviews.text: This toy has been playing for a few days, it feels great, the quality is good, it is durable, and it adapts perfectly no matter how you move it. This toy is great for younger children and allows many children to participate in it together.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey McDavid

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these. We bought a 2nd set so that he could build more with them
customer_reviews.author: Allie Liechty

customer_reviews.title: My little sister loves it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 year old sister who has shown adeptness at STEM activities. She loves to play with it and she is really good at it. I usually play with her so that I can guide her when necessary and ensure that she continues to enjoy the challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren X

customer_reviews.title: Fun building toy for grandkids
customer_reviews.text: The older the child, the more elaborate the building... And purchasing multiple sets was a great idea.
customer_reviews.author: Jane L.

customer_reviews.title: I love it for my grandson and he loves it
customer_reviews.text: I love it for my grandson and he loves it. Unfortunately it did not come with the handle or I would have given it 5 stars. I cannot figure out how to contact the seller to fix this problem. The gears are vibrant in color and sturdy and he had fun playing with them at his birthday party.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth A. Rothschnelle

customer_reviews.title: This is such an awesome learning tool
customer_reviews.text: This is such an awesome learning tool. Within minutes of receiving the package we had it opened and started assembling the gears. Kept my nephew entertained for hours. The gears are made from sturdy plastic, I can see this being handed down to another child at some point down the road as it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Judie Bouldry

customer_reviews.title: The form fit and function is great.
customer_reviews.text: My three-year-old granddaughter took to this immediately. She and my grandson build contraptions for hours. I got this as a starter to see if it had real lasting value and play time. It passed the test. Can't wait to get the motorized add-on this Christmas. The form fit and function is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I thought this would be something my kids would love..
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be something my kids would love....unfortunately they lost interest pretty quickly. The orange attachment pieces in particular are a little difficult to connect. I am hoping the kids will give it another shot in the future.
customer_reviews.author: RRS

customer_reviews.title: Kids are fascinated with Gears!
customer_reviews.text: Grandson started with a small set of gears and had hours of fun so I got him more. They are all the same size so he can really expand on his creations! This is a far cry from the simple set of 8 gears plus one handle, and a plastic base, that my son had 40 years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: So much fun! And educational too!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my youngest son's 7th birthday. Though it was not #1 on his birthday wishlist this was the most played with toy at the party and afterwards! Both my 7 and 9 year old love this set (so does my 32 year old husband!) There are enough parts that my sons split them evenly (but only one of them gets a handle) and they can both build creations at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Sonita Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Everyone can have fun with this interactive toy
customer_reviews.text: The possibilities are endless! Everyone can have fun with this interactive toy. The price on Amazon (pre-holiday) was unbelievable. I bought three sets to create a larger platform. This will keep kids and parents engaged for awhile - especially if you have little ones that like movement. In my opinion, this is just a really fun toy.
customer_reviews.author: alohaannie

customer_reviews.title: Promotes creativity.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gift. My 3 yr old grandson loves this. It helps him with dexterity, imagination and learning colors.
customer_reviews.author: t

customer_reviews.title: We purchased this item for our two-year-old grandson. He ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this item for our two-year-old grandson. He (as well as his parents) are very taken with it. Right now he prefers building "flat" items and is not into vertical gear constructions. Once the child understands the basically two ways to fit pieces together, he or she can assemble simple constructions and turn the handle so the gears move.
customer_reviews.author: coffee lover

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great toy! My 4 yo played with it for hours. I loved watching him work on fine motor and STEM learning. It’s a great gift too!
customer_reviews.author: emily

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this toy
customer_reviews.text: My son saw this toy while searching with my dad. This toy is perfect for the little boy that likes to tinker with things. The base can be taken apart and put back together in various ways, and there are tons to do with the gears. This toy has entertained my child for hours. he loves it. I will definitely be ordering more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: They LOVE playing with the gears
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the game for our twins grandkids. They LOVE playing with the gears. One little problem: in the description it indicates that the games comes with cranks and the pic shows 2 cranks. The box arrived with only ONE crank that create a dispute each time they play. I wish I could contact the manufacturer to request one more CRANK.
customer_reviews.author: Batsheva Gillat

product_meta.title: Learning Resources Gears! Gears! Gears! 100-Piece Deluxe Building Set, STEM Construction Toy Set, 100 Pieces, Ages 3+
product_meta.description:
Style:100 Piece Set| Design:Gears!



GEARS! GEARS! GEARS! BEGINNER'S BUILDING SET
Vibrant, spinning gears set imaginations in motion. GEARS! GEARS! GEARS! is a child's introduction to the world of construction and movement. Bright colors and easy-to-assemble pieces encourage children to create moving masterpieces. There are so many ways to build and open-ended components mean there are no wrong ways to build. The set contains 95 sturdy pieces that snap together, challenging your child's creativity. Children discover something new every time they play.

GET LITTLE ENGINEERS BUILDING
Boost fine motor skills and encourage engineering skills and reasoning as children create moving experiments with spinning, coloful action. The turning gears in this colorful set offer hundreds of 3-D construction possibilities. All pieces in the set are compatible with all GEARS! GEARS! GEARS! building sets, allowing you to easily add on for your child over time.

ENCOURAGE PROBLEM SOLVING AND PERSERVERANCE
This engaging set features plastic gears, cranks, connectors and interlocking base plates for endless construction possibilities! The included Activity Guide covers building basics that lay the foundation for basic cause and effect. Children can then create a crawling catterpillar and a souped-up race car, or engage in some fun ex-gear-iments! GEARS! GEARS! GEARS! provides many opportunities for young children to experiment with simple mechanics and science. The included experiments encourage them to notice interesting movements and connections, and explore the fascinating action that can be created with gears. 

SET LEARNING IN MOTION
GEARS! GEARS! GEARS! - also a great tool for mastering basic skills. While your child engages with his favorite construction toy, he's developing hand-eye coordination and handwriting muscles. He thinks he's playing but he's also learning colors, cause and effect and the concepts of push and turn. 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX?
 * Gears
 * Cranks
 * Connectors
 * Interlocking base plates
 * Activity guide



AMAZON.COM
"Mom! I made a crawling caterpillar! ... A rolling racecar! ... A ... thing!" With a whopping 95 pieces, Gears! Gears! Gears! Basic Building Set is a fantastic first construction toy for young builders. Bright, sturdy, uniformly sized plastic gears slip smoothly onto pegs on the square bases, which are easily linked together in any number of ways. Pillars and extenders expand the dimensional possibilities sideways, up, and out. Your 3-year-old will be an instant success at inventing any number of masterpieces with moving, working parts. Gears! Gears! Gears! holds plenty of intrigue for older siblings as well. An activity guide with instructions in English, Spanish, French, and German is included. And, as your little inventor grows, the basic set is perfectly compatible with other Gears! Gears! Gears! sets, including Wacky Factory and the Pulleys Plus accessory set. --Julie Ubben

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The perfect introduction to building toys. This colorful 95-piece set includes pillars, connectors, cranks to set kids' creation in motion and inter-locking plates for limitless building.

REVIEW


Includes 95 plastic pieces, gears, pillars, cranks, connectors, and interlocking plates All pieces are compatible with Gears! Gears! Gears! building sets Skills: creativity, building, spatial reasoning Supply is limited -- 

See more
feature_bullets: Different every time you build, this versatile, interconnecting gear set fosters imagination and provides opportunities to experiment with simple mechanics and science

Supports STEM by introducing children to sorting, grouping, counting, designing, constructing, and putting physics into play with spinning gear movement. Learning gets more intricate as children’s abilities advance
Boost fine motor skills while promoting reasoning and problem solving as children create moving experiments with spinning, colorful action
100-piece set includes 46 Colorful gears (blue, green, orange, red, purple), 26 square pillars, 21 six-way axles, 6 interlocking bases, 1 crank handle, and activity guide
